timeline.message: Parse descriptors for type of imports

timeline.bodyText:
Can this be split into two shorter tests for CWL and WDL separately?
(Makes it easier to debug in the future if one language parsing method is broken)
timeline.author: denis-yuen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -205,6 +206,74 @@ private Workflow manualRegisterAndPublish(WorkflowsApi workflowsApi, String work
         return workflow;
     }
 
+    // Tests 6 things:
+    // WDL workflow with local imports
+    // WDL workflow with HTTP imports
+    // CWL workflow with local imports
+    // CWL workflow with HTTP imports
+    // WDL workflow with HTTP imports and local imports and nested
+    // CWL workflow with HTTP imports and local imports and nested
+    @Test
+    public void testLanguageParsingInformation() {

timeline.bodyText: Might become more clear further down, but since this only is two booleans, it might be worth looking into making this embedded https://www.baeldung.com/jpa-embedded-embeddable so you can still interact with this as an object but it has no independent id and/or table from version metadata
timeline.author: denis-yuen

replies.bodyText:
First thing I tried, couldn't do it because it's OneToMany instead of OneToOne.  See this commit on what it originally was 79e0078
Wait...that's @elementcollection vs @embedded, will give that a try
replies.author: garyluu

timeline.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText:
could this be a problem if some jerk has a folder with a name like httpStuffIgot/data/?
https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/UrlValidator.html might be an option already on our classpath
timeline.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText: Why is this Long instead of long? I think Long should only be used if it's nullable.
timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText:
This would normally result in a database record being persisted. However, if this ends up getting called from a read-only transaction, it won't be saved.

Maybe this doesn't get called from a read-only transaction (don't have the whole flow in my head), in which case this whole comment is moot.
It looks very lightweight, so no big deal if it's not saved?

Pointing it out just in case.
timeline.author: coverbeck

replies.bodyText:
It's lightweight enough that's it's no big deal
The language parsing code (the majority of CWLHandler and WDLHandler) would then have to be disabled alongside this which is outside the scope of this PR
replies.author: garyluu
